$interpreted: Charle: What a shame...you don't want to think it over?
Barbara: Yes...I'm very sorry, but Professor Dietrich's research is more appealing to me.
Barbara: ...Sorry, Professor Ceres.
Charle: No need to say that. You've got to decide your area of study yourself. You're naturally gifted; you'll succeed no matter what you do.
Charle: I can say that...after all, you're my student.
Barbara: ...If Professor Dietrich is too harsh on me, can I still come over and whine about it?
Charle: Anytime! I know how he gets!
Barbara: Thank you, Professor Ceres.
Charle: Take good care of her, Dietrich. I look forward to seeing who she becomes.
Morris: Fools can't become geniuses just by changing mentors. Compared to Clovis, she's still just a monkey.
Charle: Your bias is really...quite obvious.
Morris: That's a fact. Even if she works hard for ten years, she still won't catch up. At best, she'll be able to flatter herself amongst ordinary folks.
Charle: Dietrich, again with that talk!
Morris: Okay, I take that back. If it's her, perhaps she can be more than just some mediocre bumbling dummy.
Morris: ...as long as she can bear my instruction.
Morris: What, Ceres? What's with that strange smile?
Charle: ...Oh, nothing. Just happy for the students, that's all. Regardless of what path they choose, there's always a suitable teacher.
Morris: Come off it. We're different. You've no business sticking your nose in my educational affairs.
Charle: Perhaps. But if you truly need my help, just say the word and I'll be there.
Charle: ...just like that Crystal research with my name on it.
Morris: Hey! You...
Morris: ...eloquent bastard.
Morris: Who's there?
Female Student: Professor Dietrich, apologies. Professor Ceres is asking for you.
Morris: ...Be right there.
Morris: An important moment, Charle. Working with you...can't afford to make any mistakes.
Morris: A glorious moment. Worth opening a bottle of good wine, don't you agree?

...Sorry, Professor Ceres.

Come off it. We're different. You've no business sticking your nose in my educational affairs.
Perhaps. But if you truly need my help, just say the word and I'll be there.
...just like that Crystal research with my name on it.
Hey! You...
...eloquent bastard.
Who's there?
Professor Dietrich, apologies. Professor Ceres is asking for you.
...Be right there.
An important moment, Charle. Working with you...can't afford to make any mistakes.
A glorious moment. Worth opening a bottle of good wine, don't you agree?
